sen.j: 山岡 景猶（やまおか かげなお）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Kagenao YAMAOKA was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.
Kagenao YAMAOKA was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.
Kagenao YAMAOKA was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.

sen.j: 山岡景隆の実弟である。
sen.e: Kagetaka YAMAOKA was his younger brother.
Kagetaka YAMAOKA was his younger brother.
Kagetaka YAMAOKA was his younger brother.

sen.j: 山岡景之の3男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was the third son born to Kageyuki YAMAOKA.
He was born as the third son of Kageyuki YAMAOKA.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため修正しました。
sen.e: He was born as the third son of Kageyuki YAMAOKA.

sen.j: 六角氏および足利義輝に仕えたが、織田信長が上洛して勢力を拡大すると信長の家臣である明智光秀に属した。
sen.e: He served the Rokkaku clan and Yoshiteru OSHIKAGA, but when Nobunaga ODA entered Kyoto and extended his influence, he served Mitsuhide AKECHI who was a Nobunaga's vassal.
He served the Rokkaku clan and Yoshiteru OSHIKAGA, but when Nobunaga ODA entered Kyoto and extended his influence, he served Mitsuhide AKECHI, the vassal of Nobunaga.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため修正しました。
sen.e: He served the Rokkaku clan and Yoshiteru OSHIKAGA, but when Nobunaga ODA entered Kyoto and extended his influence, he served Mitsuhide AKECHI, the vassal of Nobunaga.

sen.j: 元亀元年（1570年）に近江国内において2500石を与えられる。
sen.e: He was given a fief worth 2,500 koku in Omi Province in 1570.
He was given 2,500 koku (approximately 450,000 liter of crop yield) in Omi Province in 1570.
sen.cmt: 用語データベースに従い、一部変更しました。1 koku = 約180 literとして計算してあります。
sen.e: He was given 2,500 koku (approximately 450,000 liter of crop yield) in Omi Province in 1570.

sen.j: 元亀2年（1571年）の比叡山焼き討ち (1571年)で信長は三井寺山内にあった景猶の屋敷より指揮した。
sen.e: During the fire attack against Mt. Hiei in 1571, Nobunaga used Kagenao's mansion in the compound of Mii-dera temple as his headquarter.
During the fire attack against Mt. Hiei in 1571, Nobunaga used Kagenao's mansion on the ground of Mii-dera temple as his headquarters.
sen.cmt: on the ground of の方が良いと思います。headquartersです。
sen.e: During the fire attack against Mt. Hiei in 1571, Nobunaga used Kagenao's mansion on the ground of Mii-dera temple as his headquarters.

sen.j: 天正元年（1573年）7月、足利義昭が信長に対して挙兵すると、景猶は義昭の誘いを拒絶して、填島城攻めで戦功を挙げた。
sen.e: When Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA raised an army against Nobunaga in July 1573, Kagenao rejected Yoshiaki's invitation to join his army, and at the Battle of Makishima-jo Castle, he successfully helped Nobunaga.
When Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA took up arms against Nobunaga in July 1573, Kagenao rejected Yoshiaki's invitation to join his army, and at the Battle of Makishima-jo Castle, he successfully helped Nobunaga.
sen.cmt: 統一用語に従い took up armsに変更しました。
sen.e: When Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA took up arms against Nobunaga in July 1573, Kagenao rejected Yoshiaki's invitation to join his army, and at the Battle of Makishima-jo Castle, he successfully helped Nobunaga.

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）6月、本能寺の変で信長が死去して羽柴秀吉（豊臣秀吉）が台頭すると、兄と共に柴田勝家に味方した。
sen.e: When Hideyoshi HASHIBA gained his influence after Nobunaga died in the Honno-ji Incident in June 1582, Kagenao took Katsuie SHIBATA's side together with his older brother.
When Hideyoshi HASHIBA gained his influence after Nobunaga died in the Honno-ji Incident in June 1582, Kagenao supported Katsuie SHIBATA together with his older brother.
sen.cmt: supportedの方が良いと思います。
sen.e: When Hideyoshi HASHIBA gained his influence after Nobunaga died in the Honno-ji Incident in June 1582, Kagenao supported Katsuie SHIBATA together with his older brother.

sen.j: このため賤ヶ岳の戦いの後、兄と共に改易された。
sen.e: For this reason, he was deprived of his fief, as was his older brother, after the Battle of Shizugatake.
Because of that, he and his brother were punished by dismissal and deprivation of their positions, privileges and properties after the Battle of Shizugatake.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため、全体を修正しました。改易は、用語集に合わせ、変更しました。
sen.e: Because of that, he and his brother were punished by dismissal and deprivation of their positions, privileges and properties after the Battle of Shizugatake.

sen.j: 後に加藤清正に仕えて天正16年（1588年）の清正の肥後国入国の際に起こった天草一揆の鎮圧で武功を挙げた。
sen.e: Later he served Kiyomasa KATO, and during the Amakusa Uprising, which occurred when Kiyomasa entered the Higo Province, he distinguished himself as a military commander to suppress it.
He later served Kiyomasa KATO and had military exploits by suppressing the Amakusa Uprising occurred when Kiyomasa entered Higo Province in 1588.
sen.cmt: 訳もれです。(in 1588)文を自然にするため、全体を修正しました。
sen.e: He later served Kiyomasa KATO and had military exploits by suppressing the Amakusa Uprising occurred when Kiyomasa entered Higo Province in 1588.

sen.j: 秀吉没後は徳川家康に接近し、家康の次男・結城秀康に仕えた。
sen.e: After the death of Hideyoshi, he approached Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and served Hideyasu YUKI, the second son of Ieyasu.
